intro: Ruellia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, blue to violet flowers that bloom from summer to fall. Ruellia longiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
